citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility protocols had a change in Principal Investigator (PI) that was not approved by the IACUC. The PI for the dog,
cat, and rabbit protocols left the facility several months ago, and the change to a new PI was not approved by the IACUC.
A change in Principal Investigator for a protocol is considered a significant change which can affect the way that animal
activities are conducted and thus the care and use of such animals. To ensure the humane treatment of animals, the
IACUC must review and approve, require modifications in, or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding
the care and use of animals in ongoing activities. Correct by seeking IACUC approval of the significant change in the
protocols by either full Committee review or designated member review.
Correct by: May 1, 2024.

The facility does not have a current, written program of veterinary care for dogs. The previous attending veterinarian left
the facility several months ago and a different veterinarian has taken her place in the interim, however, they do not have a
documented and signed program of veterinary care in place for the current attending veterinarian.
Failure to maintain a documented and signed program of veterinary care can result in a lack of understanding and
direction in the general health and well-being of the animals.
Correct by having the attending veterinarian document and sign a program of veterinary care.
Correct by May 1, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).

cat, and rabbit protocols left the facility several months ago, and the change to a new PI was not approved by the IACUC.  
A change in Principal Investigator for a protocol is considered a significant change which can affect the way that animal 
activities are conducted and thus the care and use of such animals. To ensure the humane treatment of animals, the 
IACUC must review and approve, require modifications in, or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding 
the care and use of animals in ongoing activities. Correct by seeking IACUC approval of the significant change in the

3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not have a current, written program of veterinary care for dogs. The previous attending veterinarian left 
the facility several months ago and a different veterinarian has taken her place in the interim, however, they do not have a 
documented and signed program of veterinary care in place for the current attending veterinarian.  
Failure to maintain a documented and signed program of veterinary care can result in a lack of understanding and 
direction in the general health and well-being of the animals. 
Correct by having the attending veterinarian document and sign a program of veterinary care. 
Correct by May 1, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
